scar

Class Encryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • scar.Encryption
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NoEncryption

    public class Encryption
extends java.lang.Object
    Encryption handles both the encryption and decryption of files in the SCAR system this is done via Spongy Castle using AES-GCM 256

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      private static int IV_LEN
      IV length in bytes
      private static int MAC_SIZE
      MAC length in bytes

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt(byte[] plainText,
                      byte[] key)
        encrypts the given plainText with our key via AES-GCM key = 32 bytes Output Format: _________________ | 16-byte IV | |-----------------| | encrypted data | |-----------------| | 16-byte MAC | |_________________|
        Parameters:
        plainText - data to be encrypted
        key - the key for this encryption
        Returns:
        Binary data in the format specified above

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt(byte[] data,
                      byte[] key)
        Decrypts our encrypted data back into plaintext via our key via AES-GCM
        Parameters:
        data - encrypted data
        key - key for this encrypted data
        Returns:
        The original plaintext given to @see Encryption#encrypt(byte[], byte[]) encrypt. This will return null if the GCM MAC check fails.

      • performCrypto

        private byte[] performCrypto(byte[] data,
                             byte[] key,
                             byte[] IV,
                             boolean encrypt)
        Generic execution of either encrypt or decrypt via AES-GCM
        Parameters:
        data - input data
        key - key for this data
        IV - IV array for this data
        encrypt - true for encryption, false for decryption

      • pad

        private byte[] pad(byte[] data)
        Pads our input data to a multiple of the block size via PKCS7. The last byte in the new padded data will specify how much padding was added.
        Parameters:
        data - input data to be padded
        Returns:
        padded data array

      • depad

        private byte[] depad(byte[] data)
        Depads our input data based off how much padding was added
        Parameters:
        data - padded input data
        Returns:
        original unpadded data
